line_1: With many a real, many a fancy'd ail;
line_2: Her nerves unbrac'd, her faded cheek grown pale

line_1: While thro' the solemn, gloomy, Gothic aile,
line_2: Look back on Rippon's venerable pile!

line_1: "Come here," they cry, "what can he ail?"
line_2: I ventur'd in; Tray wagg'd his tail,

line_1: But my Hearers cry out; What a duce dost Thou ayl?
line_2: Cut off thy Reflections; and give Us thy Tale.

line_1: While tortur'd with the town's obscener ail,
line_2: A Saint stood melting o'er a luscious tale.
